Beginning tomorrow, Wednesday, September 16, ALL Covington ISD students will receive free breakfast and lunch!!!
Great news for Covington ISD! Breakfast and lunch will be free to all students (at-home and in person). A meal must ALWAYS have a fruit or vegetable on their tray with two other components or they will be priced ala carte. Free meals will be available Wednesday and this program is expected to last until Christmas Break (USDA dependent). Parent/Guardians will still be responsible for charges on their students' accounts. Extra items such as drinks and snacks will still be priced the same. Milk alone is not a free item. It must be part of a meal.

The USDA passed waivers to allow free meals under the Seamless Summer Option. It will follow the same meal pattern as NSLP (National School Lunch Program).

This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

The Last Day of School That Wasn't:

How many times have we heard the complaint "That's not fair!"? One of my coaches in school would always remark, "If you want fair, you have to go to Dallas in October, because that is when the fair is!". He would chuckle and we would roll our eyes.

But I have to say this isn't fair. We have been short-changed, slighted, cheated....all of the above and then some. Today was the day we were to celebrate the end of the school year together. We would share hugs, shed tears, and say farewell to friends. But this unseen force that has swept the world keeps us from doing that. But we have hope to meet again soon. Sorry, Coach, I have to say this isn't fair and I am not waiting until October to say it. But all the Covington staff loves you guys.

King Solomon said it best:

Ecclesiastes 3:4 a time to weep, and a time to laugh;
a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

Go Owls!!!

Their field visit also included helping with all functions of the afternoon ‚Äúshift‚Äù‚Äîwash & fold linens, bathing dog, sweep/mop, wash bowls, poop-patrol, walk dogs, etc. It is always refreshing to witness young leaders contributing selfless service.
